page.title: 20A SHOPPING SURVEY
page.content: The shopping area near Robert Clack School is on Whalebone Lane.It has a supermarket,D.I.Y. stores,a bread shop,newsagents and a health studio. When pupils from the school surveyed shoppers they found that most local people shopped here more than once a week.This is because it is convenient, the shops are close together,there are zebra crossings and there is a car park behind the supermarket. Romford is the large market town where people do their main shopping (clothes and furniture).There is a good variety of shops,a pedestrian walkway,and ample parking spaces.Many shoppers use public transport. People in this area rarely shop in London.Over half our pupils said they went just 3 to 5 times a year.Many went less often than this.
